arm_group.description: This is a prospective cross-sectional study of 200 HL survivors whose treatment included mediastinal RT at initial diagnosis or relapse, and are at least 5 years from last HL treatment.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will test whether cardiac MRI can improve early detection of Hodgkin lymphoma
      associated heart disease compared to a stress echocardiogram. By doing both stress
      echocardiography and cardiac MRI, we will compare the ability of the two tests to detect
      heart disease.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tissue and Functional Assessment of Myocardial Injury in Hodgkin Lymphoma (HL) Survivors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Classical HL diagnosis treated at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center.

          -  Age > or = to 18 years at time of initial diagnosis.

          -  Treatment for HL that included mediastinal RT at initial diagnosis or relapse.

          -  >  or = to 5 years from last HL treatment.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Primary HL diagnosis prior to 1980.

          -  Additional mediastinal RT or subsequent cardiotoxic systemic therapy for secondary
             malignant neoplasm.

          -  Known CAD/CHF (defined as documented myocardial infarction, cardiac
             revascularization, angiographic obstructive CAD, or decreased LV function [EF < 55%]
             during prior clinical care).

          -  Contraindication to MRI (i.e. pacemakers, defibrillators, or aneurysm clips, or other
             implanted ferromagnetic objects), adenosine (i.e. asthma with active wheezing, second
             or third degree heart block, recent use [within 7 days] of dipyridamole, known
             adenosine hypersensitivity, unstable angina or myocardial infarction within 7 days),
             or gadolinium (i.e. known hypersensitivity to gadolinium, advanced renal
             insufficiency as defined by glomerular filtration rate <30 ml/min/1.73m^2).

          -  Contraindication to exercise stress testing other than the above (i.e. unstable
             angina or severe valvular stenosis).

intervention.description: HL treatment will be determined by review of available medical records as archived at MSKCC. Recorded variables will include: (1) RT - field, fractional and cumulative dose, and duration; (2) chemotherapy - regimen, planned interval, dose per cycle, and cumulative dosages.
Both imaging tests will be performed within a 30 day interval, with the two modalities interpreted by dedicated study investigators blinded to the results of the other modality.
Both imaging tests will be performed within a 30 day interval, with the two modalities interpreted by dedicated study investigators blinded to the results of the other modality.

clinical_study.official_title: Tissue and Functional Assessment of Myocardial Injury in Hodgkin Lymphoma (HL) Survivors

primary_outcome.description: detected by cardiac MRI to that detected by stress echocardiography among a broadly representative cohort of Hodgkin lymphoma survivors.
primary_outcome.measure: compare the prevalence of cardiac injury
